reusing_address_alert: For privacy reasons, reusing addresses is highly discouraged.
addresses_empty: You haven't generated addresses yet. Click above to generate one.
locked_balance_tooltip: Locked Wits are tokens which belong to you. These tokens can't be spent until a certain date. You can learn more about locked wits {0}.
repeated_variable_key: This key is repeated. Change the variable name before continue editing
aggregations_description_0: Aggregators define how to reduce or {0}. They are similar to Javascript's .reduce() method or the fold higher-order function from many programming languages.
aggregations_description_1: merge the result of multiple sources into a single data point
aggregations_description_2: In addition, aggregation functions give the chance to filter out any outliers by using one or more statistical primitives.
aggregations_rule_1_0: - Every Witnet request needs to have {0} function.
aggregations_rule_4_0: - When a Witnet node gets a request assigned for resolution, it retrieves every source, applies the source companion scripts on the retrieved data, collects the results into an Array, and then applies the aggregator on it, first running the {0} and eventually the {1}.
scripts_description_1: Each source can have a companion script that lists operations that we want the witnesses to apply on the retrieved data. This enables you to get the information of your interest extracted out of larger data structures like JSON objects.
scripts_description_2: The diversity of operators that you can use in companion scripts is quite rich indeed: in addition to selecting specific pieces of data, you can also transform those so they are uniform and can be compared or aggregated together later in Step 3 of this editor.
scripts_rule_1: Each operator is applied on the output of the previous operator.
scripts_rule_2_0: Each script always start with a {0} or {1} value.
scripts_rule_3: Key-value data structures (roughly alike to Javascript objects, Python dictionaries or Solidity mappings) are called Map.
scripts_rule_4: The final return type of a script is that of its last operator.
scripts_rule_5: All source scripts in a single data request template must return exactly the same type.
scripts_rule_6: Any operator arguments starting with a dollar sign ($) will be interpreted as a variable that can be customized by the user when deploying a new instance of this template.
scripts_rule_7: Default values for variables can be defined in Step 5 of this editor.
template_description_0: Templates enable smart contract developers to easily build, extend, remix and share data requests thanks to the use of variables that can be customized when deploying an instance of the template.
template_description_1: A template puts together multiple data sources plus one Aggregation and one Tally function.
variables_description_0: Variables need to be defined here before using them in source scripts.
variables_description_1: Inserting variables in Source Scripts and Aggregation or Tally functions is as easy as writting.
source_description_0: Data sources are each of the endpoints from which you want Witnet to retrieve the data. Most times, these will be the URLs of public APIs.
source_description_1: There is no limit to the number of sources in a single Witnet request—although the more sources, the higher the fees will be.
source_description_2: In a later step, each source will be given a companion script that lists operations that we want the witnesses to apply on the retrieved data. This enables you to get the information of your interest extracted out of larger data structures like JSON objects.
source_description_3: Just like your friends—and your enemies—your data sources need to be chosen wisely. The Garbage In, Garbage Out principle really applies here. Regardless of the many checks-and-balances, well-designed incentives and security measures that the Witnet protocol implements, if the data sources in your Witnet requests are not reliable, either will your contracts be.
source_description_4: The more data sources and the more reliable they are, the more trust-mitigated your Witnet requests will become. That is, your contracts will be more resilient to downtime, failure or corruption of each separate source.
tally_description_0: Tallies are really similar to aggregators, but instead of merging multiple sources, they {0}.
tally_description_1: merge the results reported by multiple Witnet nodes
tally_rules_intro: The rules for aggregators also apply here:
tally_rule_1_0: - Every Witnet request needs to have {0}.
tally_rule_4_1: merge the results reported by multiple witnessing nodes
tally_rule_5_0: - Tallies are {0} and validated by every node in the Witnet network.
close_session_info_0: Your wallet session has expired after {0} without activity. If your wallet was synchronizing the process will continue in the background until complete.
resync_confirmation_0: Triggering a full wallet resynchronization will wipe all locally stored information about balances, movements, addresses and their metadata. This may help recovering wallets that end up in an inconsistent or corrupt state.
resync_confirmation_1: The process of resynchronizing may take several minutes or hours, and after it is complete, all your balances movements and addresses should be restored.
resync_confirmation_2: If the information in your wallet still looks inconsistent or corrupt after resynchronizing, it is recommended that you try to re-import your seed phrase from the 'Create, import or recover a wallet' menu that appears in the main Sheikah unlock screen.
validate_max_number: This number is greater than the maximum
validate_min_amount: The amount cannot be less than 1 nanoWit
name: Name
default_value_placeholder: The default String that this variable will take if an user does not override it
connection_problem: There is a connection problem. The wallet or the node is not running properly. For more information visit:
sheikah_description: Sheikah keeps your Witnet wallet safe and helps you build, share and deploy data requests into the Witnet network.
disclaimer_info: By accepting these disclaimers, you commit to comply with the explained restrictions and digitally sign your conformance using your Witnet wallet.
decrypt_xprv_info: Please, decrypt your xprv file with the password you used to export the file.
import_xprv_0: Please import your wallet's xprv.json file.
import_xprv_1: You will have downloaded this file when exporting your wallet in Sheikah. You do not have to open the file: simply drag and drop it into the box below, or open the 'click to import' link to select it from your device.
import_xprv_2: this file contains your wallet's private key. Do not share it with anyone, including members of the Witnet community.
loading_1: This will take a few seconds
wallet_description: Keep track of and describe your Witnet wallet by filling in the boxes below.
wallet_name_info: Give your wallet a name (e.g. 'Main', 'HODL', 'For Smart Contracts'). Note: Your wallet's title will be visible from your wallet list in Sheikah's homepage
wallet_description_info: Let your future self know the main functions and details of the wallet. Note: the description will be visible only after you open your wallet
wallet_disclaimer_1: A wallet is an app that keeps your credentials safe and lets you interface with the Witnet blockchain in many ways: from transferring Wit to someone else to creating smart contracts.
wallet_disclaimer_2: You should never share your seed phrase with anyone. We at Witnet do not store your seed phrase and will never ask you to share it with us. If you lose your seed phrase, you will permanently lose access to your wallet and your funds.
wallet_disclaimer_3: If someone finds or sees your seed phrase, they will have access to your wallet and all of your funds.
wallet_disclaimer_4: We recommend storing your seed phrase on paper somewhere safe. Do not store it in a file on your computer or anywhere electronically.
wallet_import_seed: Please type your 12 word seed phrase.
wallet_import_seed_info: Please ensure you do not add any extra spaces between words or at the beginning or end of the phrase.
wallet_seed_backup_0_1: These 12 random words are your Witnet {0}. They will allow you to recover your tokens if you uninstall Sheikah or forget your password:
wallet_seed_backup_1: Please write down these 12 words on a piece of paper and store them somewhere private and secure. You must write the complete words in the exact order they are presented to you.
wallet_seed_backup_2: Keeping your seed phrase secret is paramount. If someone gains access to these 12 words, they will be able to take and spend your tokens.
wallet_seed_backup_3_1: Do not store these words on a computer or an electronic device. It is your sole responsibility to store the paper with your seed phrase in a safe place - {0}
wallet_seed_backup_3_2: if you exit this setup or fail to write down or keep your seed phrase safe, we cannot help you access your wallet.
import_wallet: Create, import, or recover a wallet
seed_validation_0_1: Please type your 12 word {0} exactly as shown to you on the previous screen. This will ensure that you have noted down your seed phrase correctly.
seed_validation_2: Please ensure you do not add any extra spaces between words or at the beginning or end of the phrase.
insert_password: Insert a password to unlock wallet
create_wallet: Create, import or recover a wallet
encrypt_xprv: this password encrypts your xprv file. You will be asked to type this password if you want to import this file as a backup.
resynchronization_info: Triggering a full wallet resynchronization will wipe all locally stored information about balances, movements, addresses and their metadata.
variables_description_placeholder: Helps users of this template understand what this variable is used for
repeated_wallet_info: this wallet has already been imported into your Sheikah app. By re-importing this wallet into Sheikah, you will overwrite your wallet's password.
encrypt_wallet_info: this password encrypts your Witnet wallet only on this computer. This is not your backup and you cannot restore your wallet with this password. Your 12 word seed phrase is still your ultimate recovery method.
import_wallet_from_seed: Import a wallet from seed phrase
template_description_placeholder: Add a description for this template
disclaimer_next: I will be careful, I promise!
encrypt_xprv_title: Encrypt and export your xprv file
filters_header_tally: As many results as witnessing nodes
filters_footer_tally: Return results that pass the filters
filters_header_script_info_aggregation: Collect the results from the source scripts.
filters_header_script_info_tally: Collect the results reported by as many witnessing nodes as required in the request
filters_footer_script_info_aggregation: Feed into the Aggregator reducer below only the values that passed the Aggregator filters.
filters_footer_script_info_tally: Feed into the Tally reducer below only the values that passed the Tally filters.
reducer_footer_aggregation: Return and report to the network
reducer_header_script_info: Collect the results that passed the filters above.
reducer_footer_script_info_aggregation: Cryptographically commit to the result, and eventually reveal it once all the witnesses have committed their own result.
reducer_footer_script_info_tally: Publish the result into a Tally function in a new block on the Witnet block chain.
script_header: Go to %{variable} and retrieve the contents as a String.
script_footer: Return the resulting value and feed it to the Aggregator.
import_dr_notification_body: The data request you are trying to import is malformed
send_tx_notification_body:
The transaction %{variable} has been sent succesfully into the Witnet network.
It should be written into a block soon.
received_tx_notification_body: The total balance of your wallet is now %{variable}
synced_notification_body:
Synchronized %{range} blocks in total.
Your wallet is now synchronized to the latest block in the chain %{finish}
sync_start_notification_body: Will synchronize %{range} blocks in total, starting with block %{start} up to the latest block in the chain %{finish}

syncing_error_message: Wait till the synchronization is finished

create_dr_form_error_max_number: This number is greater than the maximum
json_error: El campo 'Headers' tiene que ser un JSON válido

deploy_dr_title_fill_all: Fill all the fields to deploy a data request
deploy_dr_title_add_custom_values: Add custom values for the template variables
pending_confirmation_tooltip: This transaction is now in the block chain. However, for it to be considered final and irreversible, a majority of the network needs to confirm it. This normally takes no more than 15 minutes.
sending_tx_tooltip: This transaction is waiting to be included in the block chain. Depending on the chosen priority and how clogged is the network, this may take from a few seconds to several hours.
twitter_content: Follow Witnet Foundation on Twitter to get daily updates on the progress of the project.
discord_content: Join the official Witnet community Discord room to discuss with the rest of the community and get direct support from the developers.
blog_header: Witnet Foundation official blog on Medium >
blog_content: Follow Witnet Foundation on Medium to read different articles stating our vision and future roadmap.
email_content: You can write us directly for any inquiry not appropriate for any of the other channels.
telegram_content: Join other members of the Witnet Community at the official Telegram group.
github_content: GitHub is where the Witnet protocol development takes place. Are you a programmer? Your contributions are more than welcome!
reddit_content: The space for linking articles, informal discussion, kitten pictures and occasional memes.
encrypt_wallet_password: Encrypt your wallet with a password
vtt_error: An error occured creating the transaction
dr_error: An error occured creating the data request
vtt_balance_error: Your confirmed balance is insufficient to complete the transaction. Currently, your pending balance is %{pending_balance}.
not_enough_balance: Your wallet has not enough funds
wallet_birth_date_text: By default, Sheikah will start looking for transactions from the genesis date. If remember when you created your wallet, you can specify it to start syncing from that date and boost up the synchronization speed.
rename_modal_description: Confirm the new name and description of your Witnet wallet.
update_wallet_error: There was an error renaming your wallet
delete_wallet_info: Once you delete your wallet, your addresses, templates and metadata will not be recovered.
delete_confirmation_0: You are about to delete your wallet with name {0}
delete_confirmation_1: Deleting a wallet removes your wallet data from your wallet list. Your transactions and balance can only be recover with your seed phrase.
delete_confirmation_2: If you still want to continue, please type your wallet's name, click confirm and you will be redirected to the wallet list.
error_validating_delete: The typed name does not match the name of the current wallet
fee_info: By default, 'Weighted fee' is selected. The amount of the fee will be calculated, taking into account the weight of the transaction. To set an absolute fee, you need to toggle 'Absolute fee' in the advance options below.
get_estimation_error_message: Error while estimating the miner fee
timelock_tooltip: The recipient will not be able to spend the coins before this date and time
export_xprv_modal_warning: You can use this QR code to import your wallet in {0}. Make sure you are the only person who can see this QR before showing it.
delete_wallet_files_info: This action resets the wallet backend, your wallet storage will not be changed. Once the reset action is complete, the Sheikah application will be closed and the latest version of the wallet backend will be downloaded.
delete_files_confirmation_0: Resetting the wallet backend will delete the wallet backend files
delete_files_confirmation_1: The Sheikah application will be closed immediately. When the application is opened again, all wallet backend files will be downloaded again
delete_files_confirmation_2: If you still want to reset the wallet backend files, click the 'Reset' button.
